title: Procedure Basics - Organizing Your Code
description: Learn how to create and use procedures to organize your code into reusable blocks

content.introduction:
As your programs grow, you'll want to organize your code into smaller, reusable pieces. **Procedures** help you do just that!

A procedure is a named block of code that performs a specific task. You can call (execute) the procedure by name whenever you need that task done.

### What You'll Learn
- How to declare and define procedures
- Calling procedures from your code
- Why procedures make code more organized and maintainable
- Best practices for naming and structuring procedures

concepts.title: Procedure Declaration
concepts.description: A procedure is declared with the 'procedure' keyword, followed by a name and parameters (if any)

concepts.title: Procedure Body
concepts.description: The procedure body contains the code to execute, enclosed between 'begin' and 'end'

concepts.title: Calling a Procedure
concepts.description: To execute a procedure, simply write its name followed by semicolon (or with parameters if it has them)

concepts.title: Code Reusability
concepts.description: Procedures let you write code once and use it multiple times, reducing duplication

examples.title: Simple Procedure
examples.description: A basic procedure that displays a greeting message
examples.expectedOutput:
Program starting...
Hello from the procedure!
This is line 2
Program ending...

examples.title: Reusing a Procedure
examples.description: You can call the same procedure multiple times

examples.title: Multiple Procedures
examples.description: You can define multiple procedures in the same program

exercises.title: Create a Greeting Procedure
exercises.description: Create a procedure called `ShowGreeting` that displays a welcome message. Call it twice from the main program.
hints: Use the 'procedure' keyword followed by the procedure name
Put the code to execute between 'begin' and 'end'
Call the procedure by writing its name
You can call the same procedure as many times as you want

exercises.title: Menu Display
exercises.description: Create three procedures: `ShowMainMenu`, `ShowHelp`, and `ShowAbout`. Each should display different menu information. Call all three from the main program.
hints: Create each procedure with a descriptive name
Each procedure should display different information
Call them in sequence from the main program
Add empty WriteLn() between calls for spacing

content.summary:
Excellent work! You've learned:

- How to declare procedures using the `procedure` keyword
- Defining procedure bodies with `begin` and `end`
- Calling procedures by name
- Reusing procedures to avoid code duplication
- Organizing code into logical, named blocks

Procedures are fundamental to writing clean, organized code. They help break down complex problems into manageable pieces!
content.nextSteps: Next, you'll learn about **functions** - similar to procedures, but they can return values! This opens up powerful new possibilities for your programs.
